attention1.ptxt: To avoid getting burned, do not remove radiator cap while engine and radiator are still hot. Scalding fluid and steam can gush out under pressure if cap is taken off too soon.

s1.ptxt: Check cooling system for leakage or damage.
Check coolant for proper level and freeze protection.
Check coolant leaks from cooling system according to the following procedure.

s2.ptxt: Attach pressure tester (1) to water filler, and then apply specified pressure to cooling system.
Check that cooling system holds the pressure.
If cooling system does not hold applied pressure, Check cooling system for coolant leaks.

s1.ptxt: Check radiator cap according to the following procedure.

s2.ptxt: Attach pressure tester (1) to radiator cap (2), and then apply specified pressure.
Check that radiator cap holds applied pressure.
If the pressure at which radiator cap releases air is higher or lower than holding pressure, replace radiator cap.

s1.ptxt: Detach pressure tester and rinse off spilled coolant.
Install radiator cap on water filler.
